Examples.Description: Run Robocopy.exe with source 'C:\tmp\from' to destination 'C:\tmp\to'

Parameters.Name: Source
Parameters.Description: Source Directory (drive:\path or \\server\share\path).

Parameters.Name: Destination
Parameters.Description: Destination Dir (drive:\path or \\server\share\path).

Parameters.Name: Files
Parameters.Description: File(s) to copy  (names/wildcards: default is \*.\*).

Parameters.Name: IncludeSubDirectories
Parameters.Description: copy Subdirectories, but not empty ones.

Parameters.Name: IncludeEmptySubDirectories
Parameters.Description: copy subdirectories, including Empty ones.

Parameters.Name: Level
Parameters.Description: only copy the top n LEVels of the source directory tree.

Parameters.Name: RestartMode
Parameters.Description: copy files in restartable mode.

Parameters.Name: BackupMode
Parameters.Description: copy files in Backup mode.

Parameters.Name: RestartBackupMode
Parameters.Description: use restartable mode; if access denied use Backup mode.

Parameters.Name: UnbufferedIOMode
Parameters.Description: copy using unbuffered I/O (recommended for large files).

Parameters.Name: EFSRAW
Parameters.Description: copy all encrypted files in EFS RAW mode.

Parameters.Name: CopyFlags
Parameters.Description: What to COPY for files (default is /COPY:DAT). (copyflags : D=Data, A=Attributes, T=Timestamps, X=Skip alt data streams). (S=Security=NTFS ACLs, O=Owner info, U=aUditing info).

Parameters.Name: DCopyFlags
Parameters.Description: What to COPY for files (default is /COPY:DA). (copyflags : D=Data, A=Attributes, T=Timestamps).

Parameters.Name: NODCOPY
Parameters.Description: COPY NO directory info (by default /DCOPY:DA is done).

Parameters.Name: NOOFFLOAD
Parameters.Description: copy files without using the Windows Copy Offload mechanism.

Parameters.Name: COMPRESS
Parameters.Description: Request network compression during file transfer, if applicable.

Parameters.Name: SEC
Parameters.Description: copy files with SECurity (equivalent to /COPY:DATS).

Parameters.Name: COPYALL
Parameters.Description: COPY ALL file info (equivalent to /COPY:DATSOU).

Parameters.Name: NoCopy
Parameters.Description: COPY NO file info (useful with /PURGE).

Parameters.Name: SecFix
Parameters.Description: FIX file SECurity on all files, even skipped files.

Parameters.Name: TimFix
Parameters.Description: FIX file TIMes on all files, even skipped files.

Parameters.Name: Purge
Parameters.Description: delete dest files/dirs that no longer exist in source.

Parameters.Name: Mirror
Parameters.Description: MIRror a directory tree (equivalent to /E plus /PURGE).

Parameters.Name: Mov
Parameters.Description: MOVe files (delete from source after copying).

Parameters.Name: Move
Parameters.Description: MOVE files AND dirs (delete from source after copying).

Parameters.Name: AddAttribute
Parameters.Description: Add the given Attributes to copied files. R = Read only, A = Archive, S = System, H = Hidden, C = Compressed, N = Not content indexed,E = Encrypted, T = Temporary

Parameters.Name: RemoveAttribute
Parameters.Description: Remove the given Attributes from copied files. R = Read only, A = Archive, S = System, H = Hidden, C = Compressed, N = Not content indexed,E = Encrypted, T = Temporary

Parameters.Name: Create
Parameters.Description: CREATE directory tree and zero-length files only.

Parameters.Name: FAT
Parameters.Description: create destination files using 8.3 FAT file names only.

Parameters.Name: IgnoreLongPath
Parameters.Description: Turn off very long path (> 256 characters) support.

Parameters.Name: MonitorChange
Parameters.Description: Monitors the source, and runs again when more than n changes are detected.

Parameters.Name: MonitorTime
Parameters.Description: Monitors the source, and runs again in m minutes, if changes are detected.

Parameters.Name: MultiThread
Parameters.Description: MOVE files AND dirs (delete from source after copying).

Parameters.Name: RunHours
Parameters.Description: Specifies run times when new copies may be started.

Parameters.Name: UsePerFileRunTimes
Parameters.Description: Checks run times on a per-file (not per-pass) basis.

Parameters.Name: InterPacketGap
Parameters.Description: Specifies the inter-packet gap to free bandwidth on slow lines.

Parameters.Name: SymbolicLink
Parameters.Description: Follows the symbolic link and copies the target.

Parameters.Name: Archive
Parameters.Description: Copies only files for which the Archive attribute is set.

Parameters.Name: ResetArchiveAttribute
Parameters.Description: Copies only files for which the Archive attribute is set, and resets the Archive attribute.

Parameters.Name: IncludeAttribute
Parameters.Description: Includes only files for which any of the specified attributes are set.

Parameters.Name: ExcludeAttribute
Parameters.Description: Excludes files for which any of the specified attributes are set.

Parameters.Name: ExcludeFileName
Parameters.Description: Excludes files that match the specified names or paths. Note that FileName can include wildcard characters (* and ?).

Parameters.Name: ExcludeDirectory
Parameters.Description: Excludes directories that match the specified names and paths.

Parameters.Name: ExcludeChangedFiles
Parameters.Description: Excludes changed files.

Parameters.Name: ExcludeNewerFiles
Parameters.Description: Excludes newer files.

Parameters.Name: ExcludeLonelyFiles
Parameters.Description: Excludes lonely files and directories.

Parameters.Name: IncludeSameFiles
Parameters.Description: Includes the same files.

Parameters.Name: IncludeTweakedFiles
Parameters.Description: Includes 'tweaked' files.

Parameters.Name: MaximumFileSize
Parameters.Description: Specifies the maximum file size (to exclude files bigger than N bytes).

Parameters.Name: MaximumFileAge
Parameters.Description: Specifies the maximum file age (to exclude files older than N days or date).

Parameters.Name: MinimumFileAge
Parameters.Description: Specifies the minimum file age (exclude files newer than N days or date).

Parameters.Name: MaximumFileLastAccessDate
Parameters.Description: Specifies the maximum last access date (excludes files unused since N).

Parameters.Name: MinimumFileLastAccessDate
Parameters.Description: Specifies the minimum last access date (excludes files used since N) If N is less than 1900, N specifies the number of days. Otherwise, N specifies a date in the format YYYYMMDD.

Parameters.Name: ExcludeJunctionPoints
Parameters.Description: Excludes junction points, which are normally included by default.

Parameters.Name: ExcludeFileJunctionPoints
Parameters.Description: Excludes junction points for files.

Parameters.Name: ExcludeDirectoryJunctionPoints
Parameters.Description: Excludes junction points for directories.

Parameters.Name: AssumeFATFileTime
Parameters.Description: Assumes FAT file times (two-second precision).

Parameters.Name: CompensateDST
Parameters.Description: Compensates for one-hour DST time differences.

Parameters.Name: Retry
Parameters.Description: Specifies the number of retries on failed copies. Default is 3.

Parameters.Name: Wait
Parameters.Description: Specifies the wait time between retries, in seconds. The default value of N is 3.

Parameters.Name: SaveRetrySettings
Parameters.Description: Saves the values specified in the /r and /w options as default settings in the registry.

Parameters.Name: WaitForShareName
Parameters.Description: Specifies that the system will wait for share names to be defined (retry error 67).

Parameters.Name: List
Parameters.Description: Specifies that files are to be listed only (and not copied, deleted, or time stamped).

Parameters.Name: LowFreeSpaceMode
Parameters.Description: Using /LFSM requests robocopy to operate in 'low free space mode'. In that mode, robocopy will pause whenever a file copy would cause the destination volume's free space to go below a 'floor' value. If /LFSM is specified with no explicit floor value, the floor is set to ten percent of the destination volume's size. Low free space mode is incompatible with /MT, /EFSRAW, /B, and /ZB.

Parameters.Name: LowFreeSpaceModeFloorSize
Parameters.Description: Using /LFSM requests robocopy to operate in 'low free space mode'. In that mode, robocopy will pause whenever a file copy would cause the destination volume's free space to go below a 'floor' value, specifying the floor size in n [K:kilo,M:mega,G:giga] bytes. Low free space mode is incompatible with /MT, /EFSRAW, /B, and /ZB.
